steps.title: Temporary Security Credentials in Cloud STS
steps.goal: Learn about Temporary Security Credentials in Cloud STS and understand: Temporary security credentials from AWS STS are short‑lived, configurable from minutes up to hours.
actions:
Read: Temporary security credentials in IAM - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/IAM/latest/UserGuide/id_credentials_temp.html (8 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • Temporary security credentials from AWS STS are short‑lived, configurable from minutes up to hours
   • Temporary credentials are generated dynamically, not stored with the user, and expire so they can't be reused
   • Temporary credentials form the basis for IAM roles, identity federation, cross‑account access, and delegation
Practice: Follow along with a basic Temporary Security Credentials in Cloud STS configuration example (15 min)
Self-test: Without looking at notes, explain Temporary Security Credentials in Cloud STS to an imaginary coworker in 2-3 sentences (5 min)
steps.completion_check: Can explain Temporary Security Credentials in Cloud STS in your own words and completed the practice exercise
steps.subdomain: Temporary Security Credentials in Cloud STS

steps.title: STS Misconfiguration and Overly Permissive Trust Policies
steps.goal: Learn about STS Misconfiguration and Overly Permissive Trust Policies and understand: IAM roles provide temporary credentials and cannot have long-term AWS credentials attached.
actions:
Read: How to use trust policies with IAM roles - https://aws.amazon.com/blogs/security/how-to-use-trust-policies-with-iam-roles/ (12 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • IAM roles provide temporary credentials and cannot have long-term AWS credentials attached
   • A trust policy is a resource-based policy that defines which principals can assume a role
   • sts:AssumeRole is the API action used to assume an IAM role and appears in trust policies
Practice: Review a sample STS Misconfiguration and Overly Permissive Trust Policies policy and identify what it allows/denies (15 min)
Self-test: Without looking at notes, explain STS Misconfiguration and Overly Permissive Trust Policies to an imaginary coworker in 2-3 sentences (5 min)
steps.completion_check: Can explain STS Misconfiguration and Overly Permissive Trust Policies in your own words and completed the practice exercise

steps.title: Privilege Escalation via STS Role Assumption
steps.goal: Learn about Privilege Escalation via STS Role Assumption and understand: AssumeRole returns temporary credentials: access key ID, secret access key, and a security token.
actions:
Read: AssumeRole - AWS Security Token Service - https://docs.aws.amazon.com/STS/latest/APIReference/API_AssumeRole.html (11 min)
   Key concepts to note:
   • AssumeRole returns temporary credentials: access key ID, secret access key, and a security token
   • Temporary credentials can call any AWS API except STS GetFederationToken or GetSessionToken
   • Role trust policy specifies who can assume the role; permissions policy specifies what the role can do
Practice: Review a sample Privilege Escalation via STS Role Assumption policy and identify what it allows/denies (15 min)
Self-test: Without looking at notes, explain Privilege Escalation via STS Role Assumption to an imaginary coworker in 2-3 sentences (5 min)
steps.completion_check: Can explain Privilege Escalation via STS Role Assumption in your own words and completed the practice exercise

resources.title: Temporary security credentials in IAM

resources.title: Leverage AWS STS Assume Role Privileges to Manage AWS

resources.title: Create short-lived credentials for a service account
resources.description: Official Google Cloud documentation on how to create and use short-lived credentials to impersonate a service account. It covers generating OAuth 2.0 access tokens, ID tokens, and JWTs using the gcloud CLI and REST APIs.

resources.title: How to impersonate Service Accounts in Google Cloud
resources.description: A practical, hands-on tutorial that walks through the process of setting up a service account and then impersonating it with a user account using the gcloud command-line tool. resources.source_subdomain: Temporary Security Credentials in Cloud STS

resources.title: Configure Temporary Access Pass in Azure Active Directory
resources.description: Official Microsoft Learn tutorial on how to enable and use Temporary Access Pass (TAP) in Microsoft Entra ID (formerly Azure AD). A TAP is a time-limited passcode that can be used for initial user setup, account recovery, or onboarding passwordless authentication methods.

evidence_packs.subdomain: Privilege Escalation via STS Role Assumption

resources.title: AssumeRole - AWS Security Token Service
resources.description: Official AWS documentation for the AssumeRole API action. It details the request parameters, permissions required, and the structure of the temporary security credentials that are returned. This is a fundamental reference for understanding how role assumption works.
resources.source_subdomain: Privilege Escalation via STS Role Assumption

resources.title: AWS: IAM AssumeRole Privilege Escalation
resources.description: A detailed, step-by-step tutorial that guides you through setting up a vulnerable IAM lab environment. It demonstrates how a low-privileged user can escalate to administrator access by exploiting a misconfigured role trust policy and using the sts:AssumeRole action.

resources.title: AWS IAM Privilege Escalation – Methods and Mitigation
resources.description: A comprehensive article from a well-known security research firm that lists 21 different methods for IAM privilege escalation. It covers scenarios including iam:UpdateAssumeRolePolicy, iam:AttachRolePolicy, and iam:PutRolePolicy, providing a broader context for how role assumption can be abused.
resources.source_subdomain: Privilege Escalation via STS Role Assumption

resources.title: AWS IAM Privilege Escalation Labs
resources.description: A fully hands-on course consisting of 15 learning labs and 2 challenge labs focused on exploiting IAM misconfigurations. It covers various real-world privilege escalation tactics, allowing learners to practice in a safe and controlled AWS environment.
resources.source_subdomain: Privilege Escalation via STS Role Assumption

resources.title: Security in IAM and AWS STS
resources.description: Official AWS documentation detailing the security model for IAM and the AWS Security Token Service (STS). It covers how to apply the shared responsibility model, manage temporary security credentials, and control permissions, which is foundational for preventing token misuse.
resources.source_subdomain: Token Hijacking and Replay Attacks on STS Credentials

resources.title: CloudGoat: Rhino Security Labs' "Vulnerable by Design" AWS deployment tool
resources.description: CloudGoat is a hands-on lab environment for honing cloud security skills. It allows you to deploy intentionally vulnerable AWS scenarios to practice identifying and exploiting misconfigurations. Scenarios like 'iam_privesc_by_attachment' and others involve abusing IAM roles and STS credentials, providing practical experience with the mechanics of token hijacking.
resources.source_subdomain: Token Hijacking and Replay Attacks on STS Credentials

resources.title: Securing AWS Temporary Tokens
resources.description: This blog post details an attack vector that utilizes STS AssumeRole and GetSessionToken API calls. It explains how attackers can maintain persistence with temporary tokens even after primary credentials are revoked and provides specific strategies to detect, mitigate, and prevent this abuse.
resources.source_subdomain: Token Hijacking and Replay Attacks on STS Credentials

resources.title: By the same token: How adversaries infiltrate AWS cloud accounts
resources.description: An in-depth article explaining how adversaries abuse the AWS Secure Token Service (STS) to generate short-term credentials for persistence and defense evasion. It covers how STS works, how it's abused, and provides guidance on detection and response for compromised identities.
resources.source_subdomain: Token Hijacking and Replay Attacks on STS Credentials

resources.title: AWS IAM - Overly Permissive Lab

resources.title: Leverage AWS STS Assume Role Privileges to Manage AWS

resources.source_subdomain: Detection and Monitoring of Suspicious STS Usage

resources.title: How to detect suspicious activity in your AWS account by using private decoy resources
resources.description: A detailed, hands-on AWS blog post that guides you through creating decoy IAM roles (honeypots) to detect suspicious activity. Any attempt to assume these roles, a common STS action, triggers an alert. The tutorial includes AWS CloudFormation templates to deploy the solution.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection and Monitoring of Suspicious STS Usage

resources.title: AWS Security Automation: Detect & Quarantine Suspicious Activity
resources.description: A hands-on video demonstration of building an automated security response system. It uses EventBridge to detect suspicious IAM events (like unauthorized STS AssumeRole calls), a Lambda function to automatically quarantine the entity, and SNS for notifications.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection and Monitoring of Suspicious STS Usage

resources.title: GuardDuty IAM finding types
resources.description: Official AWS GuardDuty documentation detailing the specific finding types related to IAM. This is a critical reference for understanding how GuardDuty automatically detects suspicious activity related to credential usage, including anomalies in STS AssumeRole calls and other temporary credential abuse.
resources.source_subdomain: Detection and Monitoring of Suspicious STS Usage
